available.CondClass: Flags whether a condition is a policy restriction
available.CondDedType2Other: Special condition other building deductible type
available.CondLimitType2Other: Special condition other building limit type
available.CondMaxDed2Other: Special condition maximum other building deductible
available.CondMinDed2Other: Special condition minimum other building deductible
available.CondNumber: Condition number identifies a unique set of condition financial terms applicable to one or more CondTag's.
available.CondPriority: Condition priority: specifies the order in which special conditions apply if multiple conditions apply to one location.
available.CondTag: Identifies a group of locations which are subject to one or more conditions.
available.CountryCode: Country code (based on ISO3166 alpha-2 codes)
available.DebrisRemovalFactor: A factor for a conditional coverage which tends to apply to all steps and is to cover Debris Removal. This value, entered as a decimal, should be the same for all steps for a policy contract and must be a value >0. For example, 0.12 for 12%.
available.DeductibleBuilding: Building deductible that can be used, for example, to account for fire policies before applying step functions.
available.DeductibleBuildingContents: Building and contents deductible that can be used, for example, to account for fire policies before applying step functions.
available.DeductibleContents: Content deductible that can be used, for example, to account for fire policies before applying step functions.
available.ExtraExpenseFactor: A factor that is applied to main coverage loss for extra expenses. This value, entered as a decimal, should be the same for all steps for a policy contract and must be a value >0. For example, 0.12 for 12%.
available.ExtraExpenseLimit: A limit that applies to the total extra expense loss
available.IsLimitAtDamage: Indicates whether the pay-out is limited by the actual ground-up loss.
available.LayerAttachment: Policy layer attachment point (always treated as amount)
available.LayerLimit: Policy layer limit (always treated as amount)
available.LayerParticipation: Insurance company share of the policy layer. Values between 0 to 1 (e.g. 12% entered as 0.12)
available.MinimumTIV: Minimum replacement value for which pay-outs to the corresponding damage range will be allowed.
available.NumberOfStoreys: Number of storeys (-1 = Unknown No. storeys - low rise), (-2 = Unknown No. storeys - mid rise), (-3 = Unknown No. storeys = high rise). Can be used with occupancy types where the number of storeys are unknown.
available.OEDVersion: The OED schema version of the file - 'major, minor, patch' format i.e. (2.0.0)
available.PayOutBuildingContentsEnd: Pay-out amount for the end-point building and contents losses for this ramp. This field should only be used if you have a ramp policy to indicate the end of the building and contents payout. Otherwise, it should be left blank.
available.PayOutBuildingContentsStart: Pay-out amount for the building and contents losses for this step. If a ramp policy then it represents the start payout value.
available.PayOutBuildingEnd: Pay-out amount for the end-point building losses for this ramp. This field should only be used if you have a ramp policy to indicate the end of the building payout. Otherwise, it should be left blank.
available.PayOutBuildingStart: Pay-out amount for the building losses for this step. If a ramp policy then it represents the start payout value.
available.PayOutContentsEnd: Pay-out amount for the end-point contents losses for this ramp. This field should only be used if you have a ramp policy to indicate the end of the contents payout. Otherwise, it should be left blank.
available.PayOutContentsStart: Pay-out amount for the contents losses for this step. If a ramp policy then it represents the start payout value.
available.PayOutLimitBuildingContents: Pay-out limit for building and contents
available.PostalCode: Postcode: the highest resolution postcode most often used. (e.g. 5 digit zip for the US).
available.ScaleFactor: Percentage factor used to scale calculated losses. This value, entered as a decimal, should be the same for all steps for a policy contract and must be a value >0. For example, 0.12 for 12%.
available.TriggerBuildingContentsEnd: Ending value of the building and content damage range over which the corresponding pay-out(s) should be made.
available.TriggerBuildingContentsStart: Starting value of the building and content damage range over which the corresponding pay-out(s) should be made.
available.TriggerBuildingEnd: Ending value of the building damage range over which the corresponding pay-out(s) should be made.
available.TriggerBuildingStart: Starting value of the building damage range over which the corresponding pay-out(s) should be made.
available.TriggerContentsEnd: Ending value of the content damage range over which the corresponding pay-out(s) should be made.
available.TriggerContentsStart: Starting value of the content damage range over which the corresponding pay-out(s) should be made.
